greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiply previous term by 8 and reverse.
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: Conjecture: a(n)^(1/n) tends to 10. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 03 2020
maple: rev:=proc(n) local nn: nn:=convert(n,base,10): add(nn[j]*10^(nops(nn)-j), j = 1..nops(nn)) end proc: a[1]:=1: for n from 2 to 20 do a[n]:=rev(8*a[n-1]) end do: seq(a[n],n=1..20); # Definition corrected by _Emeric Deutsch_, Nov 07 2007
results.author: Rachit Agrawal (rachit_agrawal(AT)daiict.ac.in), Oct 31 2007
